quest.name: The Ultimate Ballad
journal: Alys would like to introduce you to someone.

A wandering minstrel has come to Revenant's Toll in search of inspiration─namely, tales of heroic feats and derring-do. Alys can think of no one better qualified to quench the traveler's thirst for tales, and urges you regale the minstrel with your greatest exploits.

Your words serve to satisfy the minstrel beyond measure, who at once composes a ballad of your battle with the Ultima Weapon. Alas, his penchant for exaggeration has transformed the trial into something quite unlike what you remember...

※The Minstrel's Ballad: Ultima's Bane can be accessed via the Duty Finder.

Using the power of your imagination, you relive the events of that fateful day in the Praetorium, as described in the minstrel's ballad. Considering how certain details differ drastically, it may behoove you to correct the minstrel's misconceptions.

The minstrel makes no apologies for embellishing your tale, claiming that others would have done the same in time. A valid point, to be sure, though his artistic license will only serve to hasten the process...
objectives: Confront the Ultima Weapon in the Minstrel's Ballad: Ultima's Bane.

dialogue.name: ALYS
dialogue.text: Your reputation precedes you, Forename. In fact, it's for that reason that I'd like to introduce you to someone.

dialogue.name: ALYS
dialogue.text: That minstrel at the end of the bar wandered in here the other day─said he was seeking inspiration for a new ballad, the sort only an adventurer of distinction could provide.

dialogue.name: ALYS
dialogue.text: Who better than the womanman who saved the world to give this minstrel the stories he seeks, eh? Humor the gentleman, I say!

dialogue.name: WANDERINGMINSTREL
dialogue.text:
Dawn may banish even the darkest night,
Yet ever shall primal desires burn.

dialogue.name: WANDERINGMINSTREL
dialogue.text:
Two swords shall vie to lay them low─
A blade born of light and a blade forged of might.
Alas, man may entrust his fate unto but one.

dialogue.name: WANDERINGMINSTREL
dialogue.text: Lest you wonder, these are the words of Archon Louisoix. While not written as poetry, I find poetry within them nonetheless.

dialogue.name: WANDERINGMINSTREL
dialogue.text: By the gods─Forename, it is you! We do indeed share a connection, don't we? Looking at you now, I am reminded of Mezaya's final verse:

dialogue.name: WANDERINGMINSTREL
dialogue.text:
Seven waning moons see seven suns rise,
Divine order roils, fallen corpses writhe.

dialogue.name: WANDERINGMINSTREL
dialogue.text:
Souls from aether far, strangers from strange lands,
Yester with thine eyes, morrow by thine hands.

dialogue.name: WANDERINGMINSTREL
dialogue.text: A toast to your triumphant return, familiar stranger.

dialogue.name: WANDERINGMINSTREL
dialogue.text: It is a pleasure to be reunited with you once more. Yours is a tale that was destined to be immortalized in song.

dialogue.name: WANDERINGMINSTREL
dialogue.text: Years ago, when I arrived in this land, I was beset with peril day and night─forced to endure countless trials which tested my mind, my body, and my faith.

dialogue.name: WANDERINGMINSTREL
dialogue.text: And I am not ashamed to admit that I would have faltered, had it not been for the help of a handful of nameless adventurers. Honest men and women who proffered the hand of friendship to a weary soul and led him safe from the darkness.

dialogue.name: WANDERINGMINSTREL
dialogue.text: When I look upon you, I am reminded of them. I can tell that you are well traveled, and possessed of both constancy and character. You are a womanman of the adventuring profession, yes?

dialogue.name: WANDERINGMINSTREL
dialogue.text: I seek a valiant hero whose deeds might serve as inspiration, and I have reason to believe I have found herhim.

dialogue.name: WANDERINGMINSTREL
dialogue.text: After all, was it not you who faced Gaius van Baelsar and his Allagan weapon? You must tell me everything─everything─that happened! Omit nary a single detail, I beg of you!

dialogue.name: WANDERINGMINSTREL
dialogue.text: ...Truly a tale worthy of legend! And so eerily it matches the writings of Archon Louisoix!

dialogue.name: WANDERINGMINSTREL
dialogue.text:
Two swords shall vie to lay them low─
A blade born of light and a blade forged of might.
Alas, man may entrust his fate unto but one.

dialogue.name: WANDERINGMINSTREL
dialogue.text: The Black Wolf was a conqueror who aspired to rule through might, and the weapon was key to his ambitions.

dialogue.name: WANDERINGMINSTREL
dialogue.text: Yet in the end, the people of Eorzea entrusted their fates to a brilliant blade─the Warrior of Light.

dialogue.name: WANDERINGMINSTREL
dialogue.text: A rather fitting moniker, in my humble opinion.

dialogue.name: WANDERINGMINSTREL
dialogue.text: Thank you. At last, I have found the inspiration I sought: a battle to decide the fate of a realm!

dialogue.name: WANDERINGMINSTREL
dialogue.text: The words, the notes─I feel them coming together! Your tale, Forename Surname─your song!

dialogue.name: WANDERINGMINSTREL
dialogue.text:
From an era long forgotten,♪
A blade of midnight drawn,♪
From a battlefield awakened,♪
A warrior who bears the dawn...♪

dialogue.name: WANDERINGMINSTREL
dialogue.text:
From an era long forgotten,♪
A blade of midnight drawn,♪
From a distant land uncharted,♪
A warrior who bears the dawn...♪

dialogue.name: WANDERINGMINSTREL
dialogue.text: That might be my best work yet! Was it not just as you remember, Forename?

dialogue.name: WANDERINGMINSTREL
dialogue.text: ...Come now, what's the harm in a little exaggeration? I only changed a few details for dramatic effect.

dialogue.name: WANDERINGMINSTREL
dialogue.text: And even if I had not, others would have done so eventually. 'Tis the nature of every story to grow with each telling.
